sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle XYZ, the lengths of the two equal sides are each 8 cm, and the length of the base is 12 cm. What is the length of each of the other two sides of the triangle?
message_2: Since the triangle XYZ is an isosceles triangle with two equal sides, the lengths of the other two sides (XY and YZ) are already given as 8 cm each.
